body:
looks like this issue is already resolved by the latest commits at `master` branch
https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-forked-6c9e0?file=/src/index.js

ðŸ‘¨ðŸ»â€ðŸ’» fix useFieldArray delete dirty fields (#3119)
ðŸ‘¨ðŸ»â€ðŸ’» improve field array dirty fields checking (#3127)

let me know if the CSB is working as expected.

'Append' is OK, but 'prepend' and 'insert at' still seems to be buggy. Using them not only adds multiple rows to the the dirtyFields, but sets the corresponding values of the initial, unchanged fields to dirty too.

'Delete' is also inconsistent. If I remove then reset the initial fields, everything is OK. If I append a row and reset the form it's fine too. But if I remove a row, reset the form, then append a new one both the new one and the previously deleted and reset rows are marked dirty.

> Using them not only adds multiple rows to the the dirtyFields, but sets the corresponding values of the initial, unchanged fields to dirty too.

if defaultValue is 3, 2, 1 prepend means to push all the item down 0, 3, 2, 1 which makes all dirty.

> 'Delete' is also inconsistent. If I remove then reset the initial fields, everything is OK. If I append a row and reset the form it's fine too. But if I remove a row, reset the form, then append a new one both the new one and the previously deleted and reset rows are marked dirty.

can you list out the steps to reproduce? Happy to investigate if there is an issue with it.

> > 'Delete' is also inconsistent. If I remove then reset the initial fields, everything is OK. If I append a row and reset the form it's fine too. But if I remove a row, reset the form, then append a new one both the new one and the previously deleted and reset rows are marked dirty.
> 
> can you list out the steps to reproduce? Happy to investigate if there is an issue with it.

1. Remove the second row (Or the first, or all)
2. reset the form
3. append a row

Actual behaviour: 
The second and the third rows are marked dirty

Expected behaviour:
Only the third row is marked dirty, since the previous modifications were undid by reset.

> > > 'Delete' is also inconsistent. If I remove then reset the initial fields, everything is OK. If I append a row and reset the form it's fine too. But if I remove a row, reset the form, then append a new one both the new one and the previously deleted and reset rows are marked dirty.
> > 
> > 
> > can you list out the steps to reproduce? Happy to investigate if there is an issue with it.
> 
> 1. Remove the second row (Or the first, or all)
> 2. reset the form
> 3. append a row
> 
> Actual behaviour:
> The second and the third rows are marked dirty
> 
> Expected behaviour:
> Only the third row is marked dirty, since the previous modifications were undid by reset.

Thanks. this issue is valid, will investigate for a fix.

> > Using them not only adds multiple rows to the the dirtyFields, but sets the corresponding values of the initial, unchanged fields to dirty too.
> 
> if defaultValue is 3, 2, 1 prepend means to push all the item down 0, 3, 2, 1 which makes all dirty.

I'm not sure if I agree with this behaviour. The fields have id-s. Even if I prepend a new field, the ids of the old fields remain the same. And that's cool because I think they are unchanged, they are the same, just moved one position further. Why do the fields have ids if only their position is considered when marked dirty?

> if defaultValue is 3, 2, 1 prepend means to push all the item down 0, 3, 2, 1 which makes all dirty.

Even accepting this logic 'insert at' is buggy. Check the CBS example. 'Insert at' inserts a row at position 2, but field at position 0 is marked as dirty too.

> > if defaultValue is 3, 2, 1 prepend means to push all the item down 0, 3, 2, 1 which makes all dirty.
> 
> Even accepting this logic 'insert at' is buggy. Check the CBS example. 'Insert at' inserts a row at position 2, but field at position 0 is marked as dirty too.

will fix that as well, thanks.
each input has a unique name, by shifting or changing the position. the input value needs/should validate against the `defaultValues` to produce `dirtyFields`.

> each input has a unique name, by shifting or changing the position. the input value needs/should validate against the `defaultValues` to produce `dirtyFields`.

Oh, I see. Thanks for the explanation.
